H453.def: = man, also known as {L:Eliab<SDBH:אֱלִיאָב>} and {L:Eliel<SDBH:אֱלִיאֵל>}; ◄ descendant of {L:Elkanah<SDBH:אֶלְקָנָה>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► ancestor of {L:Samuel<SDBH:שְׁמוּאֵל>} and {L:Heman<SDBH:הֵימָן>}

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3803.def: = process by which humans refrain from action for some time

H2191.def: = state in which an object is relatively small in size

H2331.def: = causative action by which humans convey information to other humans through speech

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1843.def: = state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H551.def: = marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H8549.def: = state in which an object is fully, unaffected and undiminished in its shape and form

H1844.def: = state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3524.def: = state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H1639.def: = causative action by which humans cut off (part of) their hair

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3678.def: = large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H1361.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H631.def: = causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

H2131.def: = chains or shackles attached to the feet of a captive ► in order to restrain their movements

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H1396.def: = process by which humans gain strength, power, and authority, which enables them to do things that others are unable to accomplish

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

4.gl: to uncover (someone's) ear(s) > to open (someone's) ear(s)

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5647.def: = state in which humans, either as individuals or as groups, are in a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which is normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5273.def: = state in which a person or object has qualities that inspire love and appreciation

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7973.def: = tool designed to inflict bodily harm, used in armed conflicts

H1478.def: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2611.def: = state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H631.def: = causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H5290.def: = the period of a person's life ranging from early childhood to adulthood

H6945.def: = man employed to have sexual intercourse with other people as part of local fertility rites; ► forbidden under Mosaic law

H2502.def: = causative action by which humans or animals partially or completely remove an object that used to be attached to another object

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H3906.def: = causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans

12.gl: to uncover (someone's) ear(s) > to open (someone's) ear(s)

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H4164.def: = state in which humans experience distress

H5183.def: = action by which humans move down from a place of higher elevation

H7979.def: literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H1880.def: = state in which the body of humans or animals contains a significant quantity of fat, ≈ which used to be regarded as the best part and associated with health and well-being

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

8.gl: to be filled > to be engaged

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

22.gl: to cause (others) to turn (from the right way)

H7602.def: = process by which humans or animals strain for breath with an open mouth, ◄ caused by exhaustion or pain

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H4175.def: = rain that falls from mid-October until early November; ► moistens the soil and makes it soft to facilitate plowing and sowing; ≈ regarded as a blessing from YHWH ({A:ABD})

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H7679.def: = causative process by which deities causes a nation to be regarded with respect

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H7891.def: = action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7689.def: = state in which objects or events are many in number or frequency

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H2714.def: = action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events

H1639.def: = causative action by which humans cut off (part of) their hair

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2212.def: = process by which some element is purged of less pure elements

H4306.def: = water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive

H108.def: = body of water; ◄ located both below the earth and in the sky, coming up or down to water the earth

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5140.def: poetic term; = process by which liquids or odors move from one place to another

H7491.def: literally: to drip; hence: = state in which an area is saturated with water to the extent that it starts overflowing; this can be used for the clouds when they start producing rain, but also for the earth after abundant rain; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an abundance of good things

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H5645.def: = mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds

H4666.def: = cloth, attached to a boat ► in such a way as to catch the wind and propel the boat through the water

H8663.def: = action by which humans speak loudly

H5521.def: = a shelter, ◄ made of fragile materials such as leaves and branches, ► for the purpose of protection from rain and sun for both humans and animals; used by people who needed a temporary shelter, such as nomads, soldiers, and farm workers in the field; ≈ by extension, figuratively God's protection over his people, God's shelter for himself; also a metaphor for Jerusalem, the dwelling of God's people; also by extension, a place where ferocious animals can hide in order to attack someone

H6566.def: = causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H400.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H4342.def: = state in which substances are large in quantity

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H6293.def: = process by which humans or animals unexpectedly meet other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another

H7452.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H4735.def: = an animate or inanimate object ◄ acquired by humans by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself
